dict.string:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf949\cocoasubrtf430 {\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 ArialNarrow;\f1\fswiss\fcharset0 ArialNarrow-Italic;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \deftab709 \pard\pardeftab709\ri0\sl200\qj
\f0\fs12 \cf0 The morphological analyser gives the words in \f1\i Makk\'e1r l\'e1ibeg\'e1lvvuid don h\'e1liidat? \f0\i0 \'93What kind of bread do you want?\'94 all possible grammatical analyses.\ \ \ \ \ The CG grammar then picks the correct analysis, and adds grammatical function and dependency structure.}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf949\cocoasubrtf430 {\fonttbl\f0\froman\fcharset0 Times-Roman;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \deftab709 \pard\pardeftab709\ri0\sl200\qj
\f0\fs14 \cf0 The Oahpa programs are freely available at \i http://oahpa.uit.no \i0 . The programs include a basic morphological exercises ( \i Morfa-S \i0 ), a question-answer (QA) drill ( \i Vasta \i0 ), word quiz ( \i Leksa \i0 ), morphological exercises in a sentential frame ( \i Morfa-C \i0 ), a dialogue program ( \i Sahka \i0 ) and a numeral quiz ( \i Numra \i0 ).}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf949\cocoasubrtf430 {\fonttbl\f0\froman\fcharset0 Times-Roman;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \deftab709 \pard\pardeftab709\ri0\sl200\qj
\f0\fs14 \cf0 The programs are based upon free-form interaction: Within certain limits, the student may formulate her own answer.\ \ We use constraint grammar to disambiguate the student's input only to a certain extent, because there will probably be grammatical and orthographic errors. The manually written, context dependent rules are mainly used for selecting the correct analysis in case of homonymy. The last part of our grammar consists of rules for giving feedback to the student's grammatical errors, and rules for navigating to the correct next question of in the dialogue, due to the student's answer.\ \ The system question and student answer are merged and analysed together, delimited by the boundary marker \i ^qst QDL \i0 . They first get a morphological analysis, and are then disambiguated, and, if possible, assigned an error tag or a navigation tag.}
